description.narrative: Due to long distances and shortage of boarding facilities at Fr. Borghols Vocational Training Institute, the Ngora Trust approached JOA with a project to convert a dilapidated Chapel building to boarding facilities for girls as many miss out on vital services offered by the Institute. Many feel very vulnerable and easily fall out of education programmes due to socio-economic pressures. It is for this reason that most parents are wary of putting their daughters in a school that does not have adequate and secure boarding facilities. The new dormitory once constructed, furnished and fenced in, would provide a safe and conducive environment for the girl students at the Institute. It would enhance concentration and stability of the girls on courses thereby contributing greatly towards realization of the Institute’s overall goal of passing out job creators and community developers. JOA awarded a grant of £80,547 and a further grant of £10,133 to be issued in 2016.
